URTXyvvBoYlNYulIHXbiZw.text: I freaking love Chipotle. F the haters - I'm from Texas and while it's not authentic I would rather eat Chipotle than the majority of authentic Mexican places I've been to.

VF6AQEUOWtfngtM642sQyQ.text: Typical of most Chipotles, but they have the most efficient lunch operation I've seen. The place was almost full when I went in and the line was 15 deep, but it moved steadily and the preparers behind the bar were on the ball - and actually not rude, even though they were obviously slammed. Well done.

4epg4P5QxB3EbDSVQW9PMQ.text: Chipotle is one of my favorite eateries for a quick lunch or dinner. Whether you want to eat there or get it to go, it is very accommodating. If you eat there, the music is nice, the condiments are well-kept, and the tables are plenty. The line generally moves quickly as well. The food is as good as it gets for Chipotle, although eating before 9PM is a good idea since the ingredients are much fresher.

bSaZFVXpyao3N0Lpeym5cQ.text: If fastfood Mexican is what you want, it's pretty much the place to go. Vegetarian burrito with guacamole and fajita vegetables. I've found that no-meat options taste fresher.

Qru7I_6jS9tfte0vEY8mmw.text: I have had better experiences with West Mifflin location. Staff person taking my order kept spoke so quickly and kept trying to suggest things while I was trying to just say what I wanted.  Becuase of food allergies I just got veggies and beans. When I moved down the line, ( I was going to get cheese) I told the 2nd girl I was reconsidering because the portion was so small, less than 1/3 of a cup it was not worth the price to me. She said she would go back and add more beans (originally maybe 3 TBSP) before I could stop her, she dumped 3 big scoops of beans without much draining, drowning the veggies completly. I told them to forget it I will just get a bag of chips. And...they were terrribly stale.

uw4tM1PnSumtfDmUR_nwbw.text: High quality quick food. Its delicious, especially the hand made guacamole. The staff here work hard and are extremely  friendly/helpful. Recommended!

pK127jQzYhQv_xEd0wJ0Sw.text: I love the green jalepeno tabasco sauce that they have at Chipotle, its amazing with any burrito/burritobowl.    they are open till 10pm only on most nights while subway is open til 12am.    Other than pleasing the tastebuds Chipotle meals are extremely healthy filled with herbs, vegetables, healthy carbs...vitamins, minerals and fiber.  they are also a eco-conscious company and use organic and local produce when available.  I love their recent addition of the choice of brown rice instead of white rice.  You can't tell that you are eating brown rice.    If you'd like to keep the meal healthier, I would skip the sour cream, cheese and burrito wrap and pick a burrito bowl.  not trying to be a health freak but you just feel better when you eat healthier.  :)  Pretty much one of my favorite places to get a meal in Oakland even tho it's a huge chain.

ig1256bMuayxI2HGU4pjyg.text: I'm giving this Chipotle my elusive five-star rating today because time from the back of an out-the-door line to burrito counter was ~2 minutes.  MAD PROPS.  Veggie burrito bowl...always delicious.  They are NOT stingy with the guacamole at this joint.

O5DXnoZXdGmZvf2jxxJhmA.text: Quality is consistent with other chipotles. Only reason for not giving 5 stars was because the one girl who has a round face and was wearing a heart necklace does not know how to give an adequate amount of anything she serves. When you ask for extra rice she gives you 10 extra grains, give or take. The other employees are great though. As long as you don't go when she's working, it's great. Just retrain her, management.

EjQ6k_dJ86WRObS1g7ncOQ.text: Chipotle is the best place to get a fast food burrito in Pittsburgh, bar none. The ingredients are always tasty. I'm quite fond of the carnitas burrito with fajita veggies. Their cilantro lime rice is sooo good.  You can't deny that Chipotle's business practices are incredible when compared to other businesses. While McDonald's basically controls the quality of beef, even in the grocery store, making sure what we get is cheap and tasteless, Chipotle goes the other direction and makes sure its ingredients are sustainable and free range. It's so easy for a chain to want to do things the quick and dirty way, I commend Chipotle for swimming upstream.  Seriously, their burritos are tasty, they're better than most burritos you can find in the Mexican restaurants dotting Pittsburgh. Don't confuse sustainable and grass fed with healthy, however, one burrito will cost you 1500 calories.

YZx1Jj8eSwAuT_HXrXnfmg.text: I've been to this Chipotle a decent amount of times, thanks to a $50 gift card from the relatives.  It's set in a very good location, so there are always people, and business is always booming (the help wanted sign has been on that window forever!).  Standard Chipotle fare is always delicious, but if you come during the peak hours, don't be surprised when your burrito/burrito bowl is less than you would usually get at other Chipotle restaurants.  Seating is also a slight issue, so take it to-go.

EsPlo4NtK6llFpY8L55ZyA.text: I'm pretty particular about my tacos, and the hard shell steak taco was probably the best taco I've had in a long time. The steak was so flavorful, and perfect. I've found a new regular place in Oakland!

jlbSdMVqakpuqHc9b08cmg.text: "Burrito's are gods currency"- Malcolm X  I love Chipotle. There is never a time of it being bad. The only thing you have to worry about in this location  is them under-Meating you. There is a girl who works there who assumes 1 strand of barbacoa is more than enough and 3 strands counts as double meat.  I haven't seen her lately so the government must have hired her to run our budgets once they figured out how stingy she was.  More often than not this isn't a problem with the other employees as everyone there seems to be aware of a decent meat situation.  Pros: Lovely taste, fresh ingredients, fast service and good napkins.  Cons: Diarrhea

G2dKvW3dYdQX4QoKwN88-Q.text: Good luck finding authentic Mexican food in Pittsburgh!  Chipotle hits the spot with it's consistent taste and quality. The wait is never too long during rush hour lunch, barbacoa is yummy and I'll never complain about too much rice. It is hard to find parking near by which can add 20 mins to your lunch, easily. And I don't think this Chipotle carries any beer.

OikAtiOBXT6UpjRpW17QQw.text: I really like their food here! It's a tad pricey, but you get a whole lotta stuff in that burrito!  :)  PROS: LARGE burritios The babacoa has enough kick (spice) in it for you AND me! delicious--always delicious  CONS: pricey they have cilantro in everything (blech!) the burrito shell will quit on you @ some point during the meal, so grab a fork too.  My FAVE: Barbacoa bowl (no rice), double black beans with corn salsa, cheese, and a bit of sour cream

tQ8K8OnGFPfsydDEiwTxBg.text: Sadly this is the best burrito you can get in Pittsburgh (atleast in proximity to CMU). Standard Chipotle really.. everything gets tastier when its made in front of you.. thats what I think makes all Chipotle's so awesome.

PcazUmbSwBk7-mXfHu_44w.text: Big burritos, hormone free chicken, unfortunately too much rice...  Still, not a bad place. Lately, I'm addicted to the veggie salad with fajita veggies and guacamole.

GAOcgEmH4F2T2y5j5hsJSg.text: Delicious!  Pros:  i love Chipotle. The line is never long, and the service is good. Relatively good portion (though, I would love more rice). This one in particular makes sure the meat is lean and not fat.  Cons: Parking and surrounding traffic.

2me1_IuOniMFKOAGxbNgXw.text: I am a huge fan of Chipotle, but the line in the Oakland location is ridiculous. It often wraps around the whole room. While the business cannot control the line, the location is very clean, especially for a college location. On thing the business can control in the quantity of food and I feel that being in a college location students often get a smaller amount than they would if at a different location.

dgAl5UXjr6v7Pl9TNivBOA.text: Agree with the too much rice comment.  This is a pretty good place.  I like the quality of the products, the price is really really reasonable as well.  The obvious comparison is to Qdoba (and I have to tell you, though I like both, I do think it is freaking obnoxious the way that Chipotle has decided to open up right next to all of the existing local Qdoba locations that were here first--i mean alls fair and all, but it is a d%ck move).   In any case the quality of the ingredients seems a cut above at Chipotle vis a vis Qdoba, but Qdoba has better overall menu variety and selection.   I agree with the "non authentic issues as well." -- It is owned by McDonalds after all.  However, that said, I am not a culinary anthropologist.  If I was traveling to a far flung destination in Mexico, I would want to make sure that the food I was eating was authentic and True to the "experience" I was looking for.  When I am hunter gathering for dinner, I am interested in reasonable prices, and food that it just plain Yummy.  Chipotle qualifies.

IaUfkpYmK6OP4o1DviUQgQ.text: I'd just like to give a shout-out to the Chipotle employee who helped me out today. I ordered my Burrito Bowl, got to the register to pay, and realized I'd left my wallet at my apartment. I got flustered and left to get it, promising to return. When I did return, the employee handed me my food, and when I tried to pay, he said nope, it's covered. He'd tried to tell me before I rushed out the door. Such a nice gesture, and as always, the food was delicious! I hope this comment doesn't prompt mass wallet forgetfulness, though. :)

XmhiJZdiO8pvIdtmeTMwHQ.text: This chipotle is much better than other ones I have visited, the staff is well trained and they do a good job of adding good sized portions of food. Chipotle prices are always good compared to the prices of local competitors. If you have never been to a Chipotle before, try out this location

G5GES1G_Z-t30b1dINfM3A.text: They have probably the best nachos supremo in the city. Their burrito is very filling and yummy. Everything made very fresh!

OTnjoe77BhYnfBUD7CBjlQ.text: When I was working in Oakland I would eat here about 3 days a week.  I'm a very picky eater and ate at this restaurant easily 100+ times and only a few times was I disappointed.  I eat out often and it's hard to find that kind of consistency in restaurants today!  This Chipotle in Oakland is also the best on I've been to. It seems they pay more attention to quality there than some others I've been to.    Although I no longer work in Oakland I will drive out of the way to go to the Chipotle in Oakland when I get the craving. I was pass up other Chipotles to get to this one!

qtUuf0dzf_oVljpfUq55OQ.text: The amount of food you get depends on the mood of the server and the amount of people waiting in the queue. It's NEVER consistent. Sometimes, I've had to ask them to add more and I still wouldn't get a decent enough bowl. I'm a big fan of chipotle but I seldom go to this place.

D3VE6nbv0l2480vodKhgHw.text: seriously? 7 bucks just for one scope of rice and Less then 10 pieces of chicken? How do you train your employee to serve food?! The girl makes mistakes and never listen carefully to customers! I love chipotle very much, but this time this place makes me so sad.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hey guys, enjoy this &#34;large amount&#34; of food

gi5NnfunI0co2rBZdli04A.text: Not scarce on toppings. My burritos are always capped out. People who work here are kind. Just a heads up the line is always pretty long so come with time

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Come here for a more hefty burrito. Not the one on Baum Blvd. They jip you on toppings

fcvtfdYb2xv9WCqYoEdgzg.text: It's Chipotle so you know what your getting and its close to campus which is great but parking is a nightmare.

w_9CN3CG0sc67rzj7qHwPw.text: This Chipotle's food is like any other Chipotle in the country, in my opinion, which I would give 3 or 4 stars for taste and quality. However, I came here a couple weeks ago on a Sunday afternoon to pick up takeout before going to a friend's house... and it took me over 30 minutes to get my food. This location is NOT "fast food" if waiting in a 40-50 person line is the norm! One of the employees did apologize, stating that they were short several employees. However, I hate to say it, but the employees did not really seem to be hustling, even though the line wrapped around the entire restaurant. Between the miserable parking situation and very long wait, I won't be returning here again.

tSUqdGnnF2u8Yu5Sxx9q4Q.text: Never mobile order from this location. Literally paid 10 dollars for 1 scoop of food. Ugh

Nyut7bRGWcM8geYpjEjBpQ.text: I am a frequent visitor at this chipotle, but on April 25th I had an unacceptable experience. I ordered a burrito but the girl who wrapped it, in addition to being quite rude, did an abysmal job. The wrap was extremely loose so I asked for a rewrap. After glaring at me and making it clear I, as the customer, was an inconvenience to her, she rewrapped my burrito equally badly. Although I don't know her name, it was around 8 pm on April 25th and the girl was working the station with the salsas and cheese.  To add to the mess when my boyfriend asked for vegetables, she yelled and rushed him to make a decision on salsas. Proceeding to glare at him until he left. Very strange and unacceptable way to treat customers. I just hope I never have an experience like this again. Especially at this specific location.

lo-ZTzjxNTf1ZE1mmdhYfA.text: Me and my husband frequent this particular Chipotle branch whenever we are in the area.  It can definitely be busy and you have to wait awhile to get your food, but we are rarely disappointed in the quality and freshness of the food.  I would order online if you are unable to wait in line and order before rush hour, so that you will get your order in time.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak burrito bowl

R0YQBlkk3rxPwDoEwcyn7Q.text: I typically visit the Shadyside location, but when I'm in Oakland and need a cheap meal, I'll go to this location. It's Chipotle, so the food is pretty much all the same, but this location is way more hectic than any other. It's almost always very loud and crowded, and it's not as clean as the one I frequent the most.   The staff is typically pretty tired, too. I understand why they are, so I'm not criticizing that aspect. I just feel like they are probably overworked and underpaid. Not surprising, though.  In short, this spot serves its purpose, but if you want a quieter experience, go somewhere else.

m-k4iEwZmEgGYsAF76p1hQ.text: Can I admit something?  I don't get all the hype about Chipotle.  Is it better than fast food? Yes.  Is it better than other "fast casual" places?  Depends... I'd say it's better than Qdoba, but on par with, say, Noodles & Co.  I've patronized this location a few times (albeit not lately).  It's super-crowded at lunch, but the employees are efficient and the line moves fast.  I've only ever ordered the burritos here--which is what they're known for--and they've been fresh and tasty, but nothing worth really going out of my way for (hence the lack of recent visits).  Also, they're a calorie bomb, so think twice before indulging if you're trying to lose weight.  I like the guac, but I don't like the upcharge for it.  If you want something different than the usual options, you can try ordering the secret menu options (e.g., quesorito, nachos). However, I'd recommend doing so on the off hours, so as not to annoy the employees (I haven't tried ordering any of them myself, but I've heard stories...).  If it's the weekend and you want a great taco, I'd recommend walking two blocks up Atwood and patronizing a local establishment (Las Palmas). 3.5 stars.

4_7D6oSA0-t2gMgX2CfTog.text: This is my go-to for Mexican-American food in Oakland. It's a chain restaurant, so you can expect a similar experience to any other Chipotles that you have visited.  The main reason I would recommend Chipotle over the other Mexican restaurants in the area is that this seems to be most students' favorite spot as well. This means that new customers are continuously being served throughout the day which means all the meats were prepared recently. Food is constantly on rotation, so you don't have to worry about ingredients being left out for too long.

UwQWTVnDlNpuqXq3avqaqw.text: The lines are always way too long but the food is decent they need to put more stuff in there! sometimes there really stingy with the amount they put in.   All in all its a quick eat the tables and the whole place is always messy, the staff are too busy with orders to do anything else which I understand but management should have someone who specifically cleans off tables/floors as it can be hazardous.   The food is a step up from taco bell for sure but is shy compared to real Mexican food. again this is just another chain that is making a profit from cultural appropriation not authentic at all!  just Americanized food

PFWCLCC-Ri7p7ZgjSh4rFg.text: As a college freshman with a meager money supply, chipotle is a must. Like any other chipotle experience, I walk out really full and satisfied. Since it is a fast food chain, the quality isn't the greatest but for the food you get, the yummy taste, and the decent pricing, I'd give Chipotle a solid 4 stars. Only problem is that this particular chain can have immense lines during lunch and dinner hours.

XB693mAD4vSmRn2x-0f63Q.text: The food is always good, but since I work a block over, I will order online. The last few times I've gone to go pick up my food, it's never been ready. I understand I should be patient, but I feel the food should be ready at the time I ordered it for pick up.

IUrDVGXKAWA4RBHAPn0_XA.text: Great lunch spot-it is quick and cheap!  I usually go with the Burrito Bowl but do like the soft tacos (you get your choice of 3).  You pick a meat (I always go with chicken but they have steak, pork, etc), beans or rice (white or brown), cheese, lettuce, tomato, salsa choice, sour cream and guacamole can be added (extra charge for the guacamole).  They have take out or seats to sit down inside. It does get crowded for lunch and the lines are long but they move fast.  The ingredients are always fresh and they give nice portions.

N6PIBsOGnJfD0kf8Rf8Kow.text: Chipotle is always delicious, but the amount of food you get varies by worker. This annoys me because sometimes I get an adequate amount of rice/beans/meat and other times I get a tiny amount of each. They really need to to figure out a strategy to remedy this issue. Also, a few employees were covered in hickeys. Sorry this is really unprofessional and kinda gross. I hope the manager has a talk with them.

GaV5-l2g_8CdudvlEjWd5A.text: I enjoy Chipotle don't get me wrong but the line at this Chipotle is never worth it. The workers at times don't care if there's a huge line and don't even give you a lot of food. It still tastes good of course but it's hard to want to go there when the line just isn't worth it 99% of the time.

4-8bHRV6A7w5HuS0cGuW8Q.text: Pretty much the same as every other Chipotle which is pretty decent quality food at moderate prices. Not particularly large standard burritos but enough for an average person for lunch.  Visiting from Seattle, I don't know about the local availability of more authentic Mexican fare, but everywhere else I have been have had much better and cheaper taco trucks and restaurants.

rExPkB6oJgQqXVBjWZ2zSg.text: Run-of-the-mill location in the heart of Oakland on Forbes. I avoided it like the plague for many years before finally stopping in because I feared the long lines of college students; however, they people working on the line are well equipped and work like a well oiled machine to deal with the high turnover (especially during lunch hours). Food is par, still I think a bit overpriced for the quality (plus the additional price for guacamole is insanely high).

uurMsU0d4CKaj9izjX7fYA.text: Better than McDonalds or any bargain food joint around. Usually on point with their barbacoa (shredded beef), giant burritos and delicious chips. If only guacamole was free, the lament of every college student.

PvQWA5s0d40Y3FQ0TJ2Wog.text: I like this location! It can get a little busy at lunch and dinner time but the line goes fast.   My favorite order is a burrito bowl: brown rice, pinto/black beans, fajita vegetables, sofritos, corn salsa and guacamole. This order is entirely vegan.   I've always received great service here!

lm3cCesqhW9vfxIKCy0QHw.text: I've been going to this Chipotle ever since I was a student. And it has remained the same. It can get very busy very quickly here however the line typically seems to move right along. Due to the location, you'll find lots of students, university personnel and hospital employees here either grabbing a bite to eat or picking up a large catering order. Also due to the location, parking is difficult. You have a better chance of parking in a garage off Forbes than finding a parking spot on Forbes. It's a pretty busy area with Piada just down the road and next to Lotsa Pizza. Starbucks is also across the street. I've never had any major problems or issues here. Plus, they accept Panther Funds.

tm9hCNi0EHYT3G5n0MbDDA.text: Went to the Chipotle in Bridgeville on Washington Pike. Store was filthy. Staff was inattentive. Also, my bowl was pathetic. It was the skimpiest bowl I have ever been served. DO NOT RECOMMEND COMING HERE. The one in South Hills is much better.

ZIETCwnK_p26Jk44ypBdkg.text: I am a big fan of Chipotle always, but especially when I am famished and need food asap! I usually get a veggie bowl with a tortilla on the side. For my bowl, I get both the cilantro-lime and brown rice, black beans, sofritas, hot salsa, lettuce, cheese, and guacamole. The lines at this location are usually long during peak lunch and dinner times and sometimes they run out of certain food items. Don't be afraid to ask for more rice or beans in those instances and the staff is usually accommodating of your request!

P1T-7SAv8sM1JF-o0eSvzQ.text: I understand that restaurants run out of ingredients, but it would show respect to customers to communicate what is unavailable before waiting in long lines as opposed to surprising them with missing ingredients when they order. This location was missing 3 ingredients, 2 of which are part of a vegetarian order. I was offered neither a discount nor any substitutes as a result of the missing ingredients. Simply asked to pay full price and offered a lot of excuses about how their too busy to inform customers of what is missing.

gOJYqrBsI5y_8DHvaV60EQ.text: As a college student, chipotle is a staple. A satisfying meal that keeps me full. I have come to this location countless times and usually they are pretty good. Beware of the lunch and dinner lines though.   I always get a chicken burrito bowl with cilantro lime rice, black beans, fajita veggies, corn salsa, mild salsa, and sour cream and lettuce. I personally love their chicken. It tastes real and not like typical fast food chicken. If I am feeling in the mood, I will get their guac because it is the bomb.   Also, don't be afraid to ask for more rice or beans! A great meal for the price. This location tends to be skimpy in portions due to huge lines.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken burrito bowl
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Close up of chicken burrito bowl

UxrQYdFo6XQOuI4DE_G6BQ.text: The food was good Burrito was wrapped good, the staff isn't very friendly at all I watched another customer in front of me, the woman that was working there gave the man an attitude because she had to wrap the burrito twice. As I went into the restroom it was a filthy mess, the toilet was dirty the floors looked like they haven't been cleaned in awhile and the smell was really bad. Overall I give it a three star because of the food.

-6-9KcVzybxqQmbm_DtYeg.text: Worst location. Do not come here. No one can wrap a burrito, I've been given countless burritos with holes in the wrap and if I ask them to double wrap it they say it's already wrapped and don't want to unwrap it. Terrible service.

V0WZTqViaVpJPjivXeQIlQ.text: Parking is nigh impossible at this location. The lines can be very long at peak times.   However, the staff is friendly and efficient.   And it is chipotle - so you are getting their consistent menu.   Keep the line moving for the rest of us - know what you want before you get up there.

8wCmmlkOQlAhnW_ZTzWV_g.text: Great service and is a filling meal!  Somehow I only get indigestion when I eat from this place, but that won't stop me from coming back every time! Love it

5DVPSupS1A_GCjbs8UbazQ.text: Simple, consistent and filling. The ever dependable burrito has served me well over the years. There's no need for queso. Be True to yourself and you will do just fine! Plus the cashier is very nice!

oh2RvGbPyJ-Ekf6J8lWV4Q.text: Not sure what the point of mobile order pick-up is if the workers just ignore you. We showed up about five minutes before our pick-up time, and our orders weren't ready--as expected. But then we stood there and waited as our food was prepared--after 10 or so customers went through the line--and then we continued to stand there at the mobile pick-up as the cashier ignored us and continued to cash people out. It must have been thirty people through the line before we were acknowledged again. Basically, we stood for twenty minutes, having already paid and ordered in advance, and when we got the food it was cold, my burrito was crushed and spilt open in the bag, and my side of queso was shoved so far into my beverage cup that I had to pry it out and it spilled all over the inside.

w4U8PQSHgQYcrA9-XZs9Xw.text: Terrible. I've come here several times, and this experience was one of the worst. The guy with the curly hair gave me three tablespoons of rice (no exaggeration) and the girl who took my card (long dirty blonde hair braided back) didn't mutter a word throughout the entire transaction. I understand that working in the food industry is tough, but don't let your pissy mood out on customers.

juUAdcIiwn0qGjYDMYl-Kg.text: Who cares if it's fake Mexican food? It tastes great to me! I always get the burrito, despite me being aware of the 300 extra calories and the huge mess I always make from eating it... Also the staff are very friendly and efficient here.

9isiDVT1a50pVNKUZdsD7A.text: There should be a way to leave no stars.....or negative stars....this is the messiest and most disorganized Chipotle I have ever been to. Had this been my first it would have been my last. The people serving are in the wrong business as well. Most of them should be on the streets hustling 3 card molly. It.is filthy throughout and the service...well. i am so seeking to say somethi.g nice but i should have known something was afoot when i walked in an doth my date and I smelled what was obviously a burt smell. Well be the ever positive persone i am i want to try it especially when i saw that the chorizo was back...my bad thats what was burning. Oh word to the manag3when you finish with firering the entire staff teach the new ones that the rice is the cheapest ingredients you use. So you should probably use the right amount. This will give the apearence of quality covering the obvious. Good luck

ATia6-iV51rgF2cFgoDZHA.text: This branch should receive a medal for the "worst Chipotle" not only in Pitt but the whole PA state! The major issue after the ridiculous line and dirty floor is the main served food, i.e. The Burrito. During their "rush" hours they cut portions into half until they reach a point of certain ingredients would become unavailable (as one other reviewer mentioned). At one time the burrito looked like a chicken shawarma wrap with almost no meat and little portions of rise filled with sour cream and beans!!  In another occasion, which was the last for me, they were out of fajitas and chicken! ( I only eat chicken meat). I prefer the Center Ave branches or the McKnight road branch, more friendly staff and better quality as well.

HcgCbEf4UAbAYbnsqhptRg.text: super friendly and fast service here! right around the corner from the hotel I stay at when I'm in Pitt, so I like the convenience as well

TPkNfmexEoDfpq6mk5g7hA.text: This place for Chipotle is ok. I like to have a decent amount of rice because I like to eat food with at least a 1:1 ratio of other stuff to rice, and sometimes even if I ask for more rice I don't get much. One time when I went the cheese was extremely long, it was like eating noodles of cheese. Another time the lettuce was not cut very well, the pieces were large which made eating them weird. I can see why this happens, during a busy shift they might just want to throw some more cheese or lettuce out there ASAP because there's too much to do but it sucks for the person who has to eat it. The tables are often dirty. The food does taste bomb, but that's the same for all Chipotles and this one is lacking in some areas.  If you are looking to yelp for a recommendation, I like the bowl with hard shell tacos on the side with white rice, black beans, mild salsa, corn salsa (this one has some green stuff in it that is spicy, I try to pick it out but I always have that one bite that makes me want to cry), cheese, and lettuce. The guac is good but not worth the extra for me. For meats, I like chicken the most, then carnitas (has a kind of pulled pork texture), and then barbacoa (same texture as carnitas but more juicy and beefy, a bit spicy if you are weak to spiciness). I am not a fan of the steak at any chipotle, though it is popular.

Ccy8AG-loYwxWlh3hTXO9Q.text: The service was very fast and the restaurant was pretty clean. However, the portion size was definitely on the low side. I barely got enough rice to cover the bottom and did not get much lettuce/tomatoes/other toppings whatsoever.

fZMNn76JlPGO_A4ifUVk6w.text: Fastest and friendliest Chipotle we've been to in the country.   We are in a band (KOLARS - shameless self promo) and we tour all over the country.   Honestly I was blown away with how quick on and point they were.  I had to chuckle and tell them.   They humbly replied "it's cause we're used to the rush with all the students".   Nice people.  Love Pittsburgh.   One of the friendliest cities in the country hands down.
